body:
Hi! Double check how are you using your `heading` and sectioning tags as `article` or `section`. Those elements define your document outline and right now it looks like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23508800/77831247-09667300-70fc-11ea-935d-ee548b46c4e9.png)

body:
```
The HTML <header> element represents introductory content, 
typically a group of introductory or navigational aids. It may contain 
some heading elements but also a logo, a search form, an author name, 
and other elements.
```
This is following [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/header). Maybe this section of the document is not fulfilling the header purpose.

body: Use multiples `h1` each of them inside a `section` is valid. But I would recommend using only one `h1` per page and use the rest of the `heading` tags for the rest (h2...h6)
